intro: Seseli ammoides, commonly known as the woolly seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, gray-green leaves and its clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its structure and appearance make it well adapted to survive in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive foliage.
